column3: Added: Not verify if witness_stripped_size \* accurately_counted_base_sigops > 10MB\n

rebased.

@sipa has a better estimation of sighash size by removing the scriptSig
Untagging this for 0.13.1 and tagging #8499 instead, this has been deemed too large a change for a minor version in today's meeting (2016-09-01).\n
This need a decent rebase. Do we still want this? I suppose we currently rely on "good" copies of txn which have been malleated in this way making it to us eventually? Is that good enough?
close due to lack of interests
please add units in comment thanks\n
can't a relay node stuff in a too-large valid witness causing this to enter rejection cache?\n
No, because the CheckInputs above will catch that as mauling.\n
@sipa: it is possible in some cases. That's why we need NULLDUMMY (#8533) and MINIMALIF (#8528)\n
@sipa in what context do you refer to `mauling`?  Mutation/malleability?\n
@dcousens I've found some literature that uses 'to maul' as the verb related to malleability, and not 'to malleate', so I guess we should use that :)\n
